Title: Despite Tinubu’s call for sacrifice, govs spend billions on luxury houses  – Report
Summary: The United States embassy in Nigeria highlighted a recent report on Tuesday detailing the large expenditures by some state governors on government houses . The report, titled “Nigeria’s ruling class splashes billions on government . houses, was published by the United States Embassy in Nigeria .

Title: Nigeria Pitch Awards hail Super Falcons’ historic 10th WAFCON victory
Summary: Nigeria Pitch Awards hail Super Falcons’ historic 10th WAFCON victory . Super Falcons won their 10th Women’s Africa Cup of Nations (WAFCON) title in Morocco . Shina Philips, President of the Nigerian Pitch Awards, praised the Super Falcons .

Title: Over 2,000 Nigerians join Web3 Academy waitlist in first week
Summary: The Web3 Academy has recorded over 2,000 sign-ups to its waitlist within its first week of public launch . The platform offers Web3-focused digital training to young Nigerians .

Title: Jigawa boat tragedy: 16 girls involved, 4 bodies recovered, 5 missing
Summary: A tragic boat mishap has been reported by the Jigawa Command of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps . The tragic incidence occurred on Sunday, 27th July 2025, at approximately 1700hrs in Zangon Maje, in Taura Local Government Area .

Title: Blackmail won’t stop crackdown on illegal mining – Dele Alake
Summary: Minister of Solid Minerals, Dele Alake, declared that the Federal Government will not bow to blackmail or media attacks in its effort to curb illegal mining and insecurity in the sector . Speaking at a recent forum, Alake said .

Title: Tinubu has fulfilled his promises to north – Minister
Summary: Minister of Information and National Orientation, Alhaji Mohammed Idris, said President Bola Tinubu has fulfilled most of the promises he made to the North . Idris stated this on Tuesday when he was featured on a live Hausa language phone-in program, “Hannu Da Yawa,”

Title: Why  we want  to use goat rearing, drone technology to transform lives – Slater
Summary: Slater Christopher is the Founder of Solicitude Beyond Borders Foundation . Christopher speaks on what the foundation does, its partnership with Obidient Movement and how it has put in place to empower Nigerian underprivileged kids .

Title: Bitcoin ETF Inflow Exceeds $20 Billion, QFSCOIN Best Free Cloud Mining Provides A Simpler Way To Invest In BTC
Summary: Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have been making waves this year, with inflows recently surpassing a staggering $20 billion . QFSCOIN Best Free Cloud Mining Provides A Simpler Way To Invest In BTC .

Title: The 1999 Constitution: Between Obasanjo and Anyaoku
Summary: Anyaoku said the problem with the country was its Constitution because it was a military imposition . Obasanjo said the country’s problem was the bad faith of those who operated the Constitution .

Title: Street renaming: Fashola calls for protection of Lagos’ historical legacy
Summary: Fashola calls for protection of Lagos’ historical legacy . He cited the case of Dr. Isaac Ladipo Oluwole, a Nigerian who studied in Glasgow between 1913 and 1918 .

Title: Labour Party youth leader joins 2027 presidential race
Summary: Kennedy Ahanotu says Nigeria needs a “fresh start” rooted in institutional reforms, patriotism and competence . The 41-year-old youth leader said he remains morally, academically, constitutionally, emotionally, and mentally qualified to be Nigeria’s next president .

Title: UNIPORT denies viral snake scare, calls reports false, misleading
Summary: The University of Port Harcourt has debunked reports circulating on social media that a large snake was found and killed in one of its hostels and classrooms . A viral post on Tuesday claimed that a snake, described as a deity, was discovered on campus, sparking panic . The university’s spokesperson, Dr Sammy Kpenu, said

Title: Australia to ban under-16s from YouTube
Summary: Australia will use landmark social media laws to ban children under 16 from video-streaming site YouTube, a top minister said Wednesday . Communications Minister, Anika Wells, said four-in-ten Australian children had reported viewing harmful content on YouTube . Australia announced last year it was drafting laws that would ban children from social media sites such as

Title: UCH nurses join nationwide warning strike, appeal to patients
Summary: The University College Hospital, Ibadan chapter of the National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives, on Wednesday, joined the nationwide seven-day warning strike called by the national headquarters of the association . The strike was directed by the NANNM national headquarters after the Federal Government failed to meet their demands .

Title: Coffee, shirts, other products to be hit by Trump's incoming tariffs
Summary: The United States is set to raise tariffs on dozens of trading partners Friday if they fail to reach accord with President Donald Trump to avert the higher rates . Steeper US tariffs, paid for by importers of foreign products, could add to business costs and trickle down to households . The risk is a dampening of consumption — a key driver
